ygData.subject: Re: [eqbards] Guilds and Dragon Raids
ygData.msgSnippet: Uhh we ve done it on Test with no guilds whatsoever...  With multiple guilds and with a bunch of un-guilded people. You need 3 things:  1 - A leader who is
ygData.messageBody:
Uhh we've done it on Test with no guilds whatsoever... With multiple guilds
and with a bunch of un-guilded people.

You need 3 things: 1 - A leader who is hard assed. 2 - An organizer and
3 - a cop to keep track of folks.

As long as everyone can understand their role and group leaders communicate
well, in the planes you can use OOC as a 'guildchat' area so that all group
can communicate. Use SHOUT for orders from the leaders and information from
the various group leaders (IE: Cleric Linkdead etc)

You can do planes with pickup groups you just need to use your head, keep
folks organized and make sure everyone keeps OOC and shout clear for event
use. If they wanna chitchat they need to keep it in group/guildsay.

Hope this helps!

Kev
----- Original Message -----
From: "Kenneth E. Bachman" <kbachman@...>
To: <eqbards@egroups.com>
Sent: Monday, May 15, 2000 1:28 PM
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Guilds and Dragon Raids


> No, but there's more to it than you might think. You need to know how to
organize groups, buff people,
> pull stuff, battle tactics, and loot rules. It's probably impossible to
do this effectively if you're
> essentially doing "pickup" groups each time. Buffing alone can take hours
if you don't have it organized
> well up front. Heck, just getting people into groups can take a couple of
hours if you don't know who you
> have available and they aren't organized.
>
> If two or three guilds consistently work together, or if one larger (but
not quite large enough) guild
> fills in the holes by picking up extra players or another small guild, it
can work just fine, though.
>
> Kenross Cantoforjado, 49 songs, Innoruuk
>
>
>
> Dan Sniderman wrote:
>
> > I know this isn't Bard Related -but no Kabong so far - so I have a
> > question - is it impossible to do a Dragon or Plane raid with members
from
> > multiple guilds?
>
>
